title: Thunderbird
content:
I use Thunderbird client on both my PC (Windows 11 64-bit) and have Thunderbird 128.4.3 esr (64-bit) installed. I have a number of GMail accounts, one of which is a former TELUS email account which was transferred to a corporate GMail account several years ago. When the account was first transferred I was able to add it to the Thunderbird client on both my PC and my MacBook Pro with no difficulty. It continues to easily added and to work on the TB client on my MacBook Pro but I have been unable to add it to the more recent versions of Thunderbird on my PC using exactly the same settings. I have tried allowing TB to fill in the settings and to do a manual install. In both cases the error message is the same ... that either the account name or password is incorrect, neither of which is the case, since I have tried numerous times.

Am I missing something such as an extra step that now needs to be done on the PC version that doesn’t on the Mac version? Could there a reason the TELUS/GMail account in question could be added on older versions of Thunderbird but not on more recent versions? Regular GMail accounts can be added with no difficulty. Thanks for any assistance you may provide. For the moment I have set my GMail account for the TELUS email to be forwarded to one of my regular GMail accounts (which add with no difficulty) on Thunderbird on my PC so I am able to receive the mail but I’m sure there must be a way to have the TB client be able to add the TELUS/GMail account directly.
creator: harvey.burian

title: Thunderbird does not check online accounts per the schedule
content:
Hi, I'm running Thunderbird 128.4.3esr on Windows 10. It does not consistently automatically check my yahoo and gmail accounts at the configured intervals, every 10 minutes. I'll have e-mails I see on my phone from 6 hours ago that are not in Thunderbird unless I either restart or click on the little cloud Get Messages icon for that account. I never had this problem with Thunderbird on my old Windows 8.1 machine, which I only recently stopped using.

Any suggestions?

Thanks, Ross

title: Iconos duplicados en la barra vertical herramientas de espacios Thunderbord Nebula 128.4.3
content:

Mi SO es Windows 11 Pro de 64 bits y la versión del Thunderbird es la 128.4.3 esr 64 bits (imagen 2)

Gracias.

title: Problem to open Thunderbird
content:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I need your help.

My Thunderbird shortcut no longer opens. The shortcut C:/Online/Thunderbird is empty. The folder no longer exists and my Thunderbird can no longer be found after an update on November 1.

I can still find Thunderbird version 128.4.0 260MB from 1.11.24 and my old profile from 7.11. under Windows Programe.

What can I do to get my Thunderbird back? Reinstall Thunderbird and integrate the profile?

I haven't actively deleted the program and can't remember updating it.

I was just able to save the profile to a USB stick.


Many thanks in advance for your efforts


German Kann die Verknüpfung von Thunderbird nicht mehr öffnen. Diese ist nicht mehr auffindbar.. Mein Thunderbird ist wohl nach einem Update am 1.11. nicht mehr auffindbar. Finde unter Programe Thunderbird Version 128.4.0 260MB vom 1.11.24 und mein alten Profil vom 7.11. noch. Was kann ich tun um mein Thunderbird wieder zu erhalten? Neu installieren und das Profil einbinden? Habe aktiv das das Programm nicht gelöscht und kann mich an ein Update auch nicht erinnern.. Konnte das Profil gerade auf einen USB-Stick sichern
creator: mud.fischer1

title: neue Nachricht automatisch verfassen aus Vorlage ein klick auf Email
content:
Mozilla Thunderbird 128.4.2esr (64-Bit) und Windows 10

German

Guten Tag, Wir haben Listen mit verschiedenen Emails von unseren Lieferanten. Und erstellen immer verschiedene Vorlagen. Gibt es eine Möglichkeit wie man die Email nur einmal anklickt und diese dann automatisch eine Email aus der Vorlage verfasst. Das heist ein mal klicken auf die Email und Mozilla Thunderbird verfasst direkt die Email aus der Vorlage mit Betreff.

Natürlich wenn möglich ohne AddOn.

Danke

Viele Grüße

Stef
creator: ags-e

title: Bulk folder
content:
Hello

I have emails going into "bulk" email and I've read previous replies on this subject that the bulk folder is created by the email platform, in my case ymail, and if it's an IMAP account.

Firstly, there is no "bulk" folder on Ymail if I access it directly.

Secondly, the message says "Thunderbird thinks this is bulk email" (not Ymail thinks...)

Thirdly, I keep telling Thunderbird which emails are not "bulk email" to train its adaptive junk mail feature but the problem persists

Finally, I also have junk filtering set up to move "spam" into my inboxes if the sender is in my address book, and I've set up multiple filter rules to try filtering, both before and after junk classification, any emails sent by a sender in my address book into the Inbox.

Nothing works though

Can anyone help please?
creator: SafeTex

title: email accounts order
content: I follow the instructions, i.e. I go to the account configuration and move individual accounts as I wish, i.e. I move some to the top and others down. Unfortunately, there is no "save settings" option. Therefore, nothing changes and as soon as I exit the "account configuration" window, everything is exactly as it was before the change. What am I doing wrong?
creator: macmalmac

title: External Content Not Displaying Despite Settings (Thunderbird 128.4.3esr 64-Bit)
content:
Hello everyone,

Since updating to the latest version 128.4.3esr (64-bit), I’m having trouble with external content not displaying in emails. Even though I’ve enabled the option under "Privacy" > "Email Content" > "Allow Remote Content in Messages", external content is still generally blocked.

Every time I receive a new email, I get the message: "To protect your privacy, Thunderbird has blocked remote content in this message."

In the previous version, this worked without any issues, and I didn’t have to manually allow content for each email. Does anyone have an idea what could be causing this, or is this perhaps a bug in the current version?

Thanks in advance for any help! 😊
creator: scoop3

title: Thunderbird sometimes not sending
content: A strange problem... On a few occasions I have had a situation where and an email sent using the Thunderbird app under Windows 10 from an IMAP account appears to have been sent but not received. On investigation the email has been moved into the local Sent folder but when looking on Webmail on the server it is not in the Sent folder there. Other emails sent the same day are. I get no error messages. I don't know the order in which the emails are processed but could it be that there is some failure in the process , but how and why?
creator: bobgarrett
